title: Police seek gunmen who shot into Las Vegas home, injuring sleeping boy
content:
Metro Police are requesting the public's help in identifying three men who pulled up to a house and fired indiscriminately into it, critically wounding a boy in November near Eastern Avenue and Bonanza Road.
The 11-year-old boy, who was shot in the chest and arm, was taken to University Medical Center in critical condition after the Nov. 26 incident in the 600 block of N. 23rd St., police said. He has since been released and continues to recover.
The boy and his family were sleeping about 3:30 a.m. when three men pulled into the neighborhood in a light-colored SUV, ran toward the house and fired 24 rounds into it, police said.
Police released a grainy video of the men, only described as being Hispanic, running from the SUV before shots were fired.
Information on a possible motive for the shooting weren't immediately available.
Anyone with information is asked to contact Metro at 702-828-1553. To remain anonymous, contact Crime Stoppers at 702-385-5555 or online at crimestoppersofnv.com.
